**User:**
I'm about to install Verus, but I want to make sure it's safe. Can you give me the links to VirusTotal for the Verus software on different operating systems?

**AI Assistant:**
Here are the links to VirusTotal for the Verus software on different operating systems:

* MacOS: https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/8d9a74da37c9b1be5f416c2f2f92f772b086da01770d8ed6a118778f87a7e568/detection
* Linux-AMD64: https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/27aa9d8d4a89dadf1a87928664eef7dc70ef92624d62596ee6e699b064f17daa/detection

You can check the detection rates for each operating system to ensure the software is safe to install. Do you have any other questions about Verus or the installation process?

**User:**
What about warnings I might see during installation? What do they mean?

**AI Assistant:**
When installing Verus software, you may see warnings from antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky, flagging the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program). These warnings are triggered because Verus software includes mining capabilities, which could be exploited by third parties to use your PC for their own gain. However, these warnings are false positives, and you can learn more about them by reviewing resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky.

Don't worry, Verus is safe to install and use. These warnings are just a precautionary measure by your antivirus software. Do you have any other questions about the installation process or Verus in general?

**User:**
What's new in the latest Verus software release, X.X.X?

**AI Assistant:**
This release includes several notable changes, including:

* Alleviation of peer banning behavior
* Staking enhancements
* Activation support for VerusID
* Adjustments to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm

These changes aim to improve the overall user experience and provide more features for Verus users. Do you have any specific questions about these changes or how they affect you?

**User:**
You mentioned VerusID. What is it, and what benefits does it provide?

**AI Assistant:**
VerusID is a fully functional blockchain protocol that provides more than just an ID system. It is decentralized, with no corporation involved, and offers opportunities for identity applications. Specifically, VerusID provides:

* Quantum-ready friendly crypto-addresses on the worldwide Verus network
* Fully decentralized protocol, allowing anyone to create an ID with complete, self-sovereign control
* Ability to revoke, recover, inherit funds in existing UTXOs, which is unique to the Verus ecosystem

VerusID offers a range of benefits, including privacy, security, and decentralization. It's a powerful tool for managing your digital identity and assets. Do you have any other questions about VerusID or how it works?

To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources: https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/ https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/ # Notable Changes - Alleviate peer banning behavior - Staking enhancementsThis release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustment to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm**AT BLOCK 800200, THE VERUS MAINNET PROTOCOL WAS UPDATED TO INCLUDE VerusID. THIS UPDATE IS THE LATEST UPDATE FOR THE UPGRADED VERUS MAINNET**# Verus ID VerusIDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. There is no corporation involved in the protocol, unlike most blockchain ID implementations. VerusIDs provide plenty of opportunity for identity applications. Specifically, VerusID provides:### Quantum-ready friendly crypto-addresses on the worldwide Verus network VerusIDs can be used to receive and send funds, which are controlled by the single or multi-sig addresses specified in the identity itself. If these controlling addresses or the single or multi-sig properties are changed, which can be done by the controller of the identity, all future spends of UTXOs sent to that identity follow the updated spend conditions and are subject to the updated keys. Although Verus 0.6.0 does not include quantum resistant signatures for transactions, VerusIDs are themselves resistant to quantum attack with known algorithms, and we have already started to integrate a quantum secure signature scheme, which we expect to activate on mainnet early next year. When that is available, it will be possible to change an ID and have all of the funds sent to it made retroactively quantum resistant. Verus IDs can also be used to publish ID->destination address mappings on other blockchains, but only the Verus ecosystem has the ability to revoke, recover, inherit, funds in existing UTXOs.### Fully Decentralized Protocol Anyone can create one and have complete, self sovereign control over it without permission to do so. All costs to create an ID go to miners, stakers, and ID referrers. VerusIDs are:

However, these warnings are false positives, and you can learn more about them by reviewing resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky.
